name: Autoprefixer
usage: Autoprefixer helps add vendor-specific prefixes for CSS.

name: AWS
usage: Amazon Web Services (AWS) hosts this website on two EC2 micro compute instances, one RDS micro database instance, and one CloudFront CDN.

name: Babel
usage: Babel was used to convert JSX into browser compatible JS.

name: Boto3
usage: Boto3 is a Python AWS S3 client which was used to upload game covers to the GameFrame CDN.

name: Browserify
usage: Browserify allows dependency requirements for browsers.

name: Chai
usage: Chai makes assertions easier when testing JavaScript code with Mocha.

name: Docker
usage: The frontend and backend HTTP servers are run in Dockerized containers which allows them to be deployed to any machine for easy testing.

name: D3
usage: Data-Driven Documents (D3) is a resource library for visualizing web databases.

name: Enzyme
usage: Enzyme makes testing JavaScript code with Mocha easier.

name: Eslint
usage: Eslint helps maintain JavaScript code in a specific error-free format.

name: Flask
usage: Flask supports the backend web framework, which is written in Python.

name: GitBook
usage: All material regarding the development of this website is extensively documented with GitBook.

name: GitHub
usage: GitHub hosts the GameFrame source repository.

name: JavaScript
usage: Most of the frontend is written in JavaScript.

name: Mocha
usage: Mocha tests JavaScript code.

name: MySQL
usage: MySQL manages the GameFrame database.

name: NameCheap
usage: Namecheap hosts the DNS server for GameFrame.

name: npm
usage: npm is a JS node package manager.

name: Postman
usage: Postman was used to document, develop, and test the RESTful API.

name: Python
usage: The website backend and data scraper were both written in Python.

name: Radium
usage: Radium manages inline styles and states on React elements.

name: React-Bootstrap
usage: React-Bootstrap is a resource library for ReactJS that allowed us to mock up this website with features like the carousel and navbar.

name: React-Helmet
usage: React-Helmet manages document headers.

name: React-Highlight-Words
usage: React-Highlight-Words allows us to highlight the searched terms in the results of the search page.

name: ReactJS
usage: ReactJS supports the front-end web-framework, which is written in JavaScript.

name: React-Redux
usage: React-Redux manages the state of data throughout the website.

name: React Router
usage: React Router is a resource library for ReactJS that allowed us to seamlessly load pages within our website.

name: React-Twitter-Widgets
usage: React-Twitter-Widgets is a resource library for Twitter plug-ins.

name: Selenium
usage: Selenium was used to test the website's user interface on many different browsers automatically.

name: Sinon
usage: Sinon helps mock up data for testing JavaScript code with Mocha.

name: Slack
usage: Slack was used extensively for communication and planning during development.

name: SmartDraw
usage: SmartDraw was used to generate UML diagrams at various stages of development.

name: SQLAlchemy
usage: SQLAlchemy is a Python Object-Relational Mapper which manages the GameFrame database.

name: TwitterSearch
usage: TwitterSearch simplifies Twitter API scraping.

name: tqdm
usage: tqdm is a Python written progress bar used for the API scripts.

name: Wand
usage: Wand is a Python binding for ImageMagick which was used to generate CD covers for some games. Each rectangular game cover was circularly cropped and composited onto a premade CD image with Wand. Then each cover was uploaded to the GameFrame CDN using boto3.

name: Webpack
usage: Webpack manages JS files into one package.

name: Widget-Google-Trends
usage: Widget-Google-Trends is a graph used to show popularity.
